text: Conrad Moser Jr. (April 28, 1835 – July 4, 1903) was a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly. ==Biography== Moser was born on April 28, 1835 in Switzerland. He moved to Alma, Wisconsin in 1855. He was first married to Verena Dunkel. They had four children before her death in 1869. Moser later married Margaret Theisen. They had five children. After moving to California, he was arrested for burglary in 1900, but the charge was reduced to disturbing the peace. Moser died in Fruitvale, California on July 4, 1903."Died. Moser." The San Francisco Call. July 7, 1903. p. 13. Retrieved November 28, 2015. ==Career== Moser was appointed Clerk of Buffalo County, Wisconsin in 1861 and was elected to the position in 1862 and 1864. He served in the Assembly from 1867 to 1868. In 1871, Moser ran for the Wisconsin State Senate, losing to Orlando Brown. Later, he was elected Buffalo County Judge in 1877 and 1879. He was a Republican. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Swiss emigrants to the United States Category:People from Alma, Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:Wisconsin state court judges Category:County clerks in Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:1835 births Category:1903 deaths
title: Conrad Moser Jr.
